headline: Is Wall Street’s Renewed Optimism On Resilient Demand Altering The Investment Case For Delta (DAL)?
summary: Recently, BMO Capital and other Wall Street firms expressed stronger confidence in Delta Air Lines, initiating and reiterating positive ratings that highlight resilient travel demand, premium-focused growth, and solid liquidity following earlier disruptions such as the prolonged U.S. government shutdown that reduced its December-quarter pre-tax profit by almost US$200 million. At the same time, industry groups are backing retired Delta captain Jeff Anderson for a key U.S. diplomatic role at...
